meanings.sent1: The existentialistic philosophy explores the meaning of life and individual freedom.
meanings.sent2: She had an existentialistic outlook on life, valuing personal freedom above all.
meanings.sent3: The existentialistic student chose to study philosophy to ponder life's big questions.
meanings.sent4: His artwork had an existentialistic touch, symbolizing the struggle for personal identity.
meanings.sent5: The novel painted an existentialistic world where choices defined one's destiny.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a focus on individual existence and freedom.
meanings.sent1: The existentialistic novel delved into the protagonist's inner struggles for freedom.
meanings.sent2: She embraced an existentialistic lifestyle, prioritizing her own existence and choices.
meanings.sent3: The existentialistic cat refused to be confined indoors, always seeking freedom outside.
meanings.sent4: His music had an existentialistic vibe, capturing the essence of personal liberation.
meanings.sent5: The painting depicted an existentialistic figure breaking free from societal norms.

meanings.definition: Reflecting a belief in the importance of personal choice and responsibility.
meanings.sent1: Her existentialistic decision to travel the world alone showed her commitment to personal choice.
meanings.sent2: The existentialistic professor emphasized the significance of individual responsibility in his lectures.
meanings.sent3: The existentialistic approach to parenting encouraged children to make their own choices.
meanings.sent4: His speech had an existentialistic tone, urging listeners to take control of their lives.
meanings.sent5: The movie portrayed an existentialistic hero who embraced the consequences of his decisions.
